name: Hilton Hartford

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: This was a great hotel, just round the corner from where the Megabus drops off and easy to find. We only stayed for one night on a quick trip to the city. Very close to the Gallery as well as the buses, so handy for getting to Mark Twain house. We were running a bit late getting ready so they gave us a lift to the theater to see Jersey Boys (altough this was after I rang downstairs and asked them to book a taxi which never showed). We were able to walk back from the theater after though, as it wasn't far away. We ate the next night in the hotel. Our waitress was really nice and helpful, but unfortunately the food really wasn't what I would've expected. However the room was great, two double beds with the softest sheets I've ever known, and tea/coffee making faciliteis!!!

reviews.title: I expected much more
reviews.text: Being a Hilton triggered high expectation for me since my business trips usually meant Hilton Garden which I am comfortable to stay and cherish the luxury of a microwave and fridge in my room. Alas! It was quite a disappoint to find no fridge within the cabinet beneath the television. No microwave either. Being a vegan and hard at work gave me the convenience of heating up frozen foods or leftovers while working in my room, however this was not an option for me here. I was very relieved to have the restaurant downstairs to avoid roaming the streets in the dark by myself looking for a place to eat dinner. The restaurant provided me with a pasta your way option. The hotel does have a fitness center on the 5th floor which suffice for my running workout. The room itself was clean and functional. I am very disappointed with the bed and the pillows. I am still massaging my neck from the pillows that provide no support whatsover. The bed offers no support either. The bathroom door opens right unto the toilet which was a few inches away from the tub, however, the toilet paper is at least 3 feet away. Weird...No HGTV, oh well. I did love the shuttle service that took me to my work which saved me from parking fees. Front desk was very helpful with walking directions to Starbucks and the bell captain holding on to my luggage, but I never received the 6am wake up call I requested. Lastly, my hair is slowly recovering from the unfiltered water which I am sure is a non priority to most hotels, but it should be.

reviews.title: Excellent Staff
reviews.text: I've been traveling to Hartford for the past 6 weeks now and have been staying at the Hilton Hartford every week. I travel pretty much 50-75% of the year, and let me tell you, there is not a staff that is more friendly than this one. They are very hospitable and always were there when I needed them. The rooms were average, but the staff definitely brought this hotel to #1 on my list of places to stay (if only it wasn't Hartford!).

reviews.title: Downtown Hotel Institution
reviews.text: This hotel is an institution in downtown Hartford and the staff reflects an expectation of fine service.

reviews.title: No sleep due to creaking noise.
reviews.text: There is some weird creaking noise that happens near the ceiling by the door of these rooms; like a house settling or something, or like water dripping. With or without the room fan on. It happens every few seconds or so and is really annoying when you're trying to fall asleep. This is in more than one room. A hotel's primary job is pretty simple: let your guests sleep. If you can't do that, you don't deserve anyone's business.

reviews.title: SUPER DUPER HOTEL
reviews.text: The Hilton is by FAR the best hotel in Hartford. The staff from check in, baggage, housekeeping, concierge lounge all have it "goin on" first class. I can not say enough great things about this hotel and the staff that make it PERFECT! They always go out of their way and recently helped me with a last minute reservation for a colleage.

reviews.title: Nice service during a busy weekend
reviews.text: The location is perfect, nice walk to many good restaurants. The hotel has lovely faclities that I never seem to find time to use. When staying in Hartford the HILTON is always my choice and NEVER has let me down! Thanks to all...TR

reviews.title: Great Location - Outdated Room
reviews.text: We stayed here during the Winterfest volleyball tournament, along with a number of other teams from the Northeast US. The hotel was very busy that weekend, but that didn't seem to phase the staff at all. We were greeted pleasantly when we checked in, which was nice after the hectic drive through downtown Hartford traffic. We had asked for a room with a king size bed and a cot for our daughter. The cot was not in the room when we arrived, but was delivered shortly after we checked in. My wife ate at the restaurant the first night while my daughter and I went to the first night activities at the convention center. The two of us had room service when we returned, which was a thrill for my daughter.

reviews.title: Good Value
reviews.text: Our team had to play in the early pools on the first day, and the hotel restaurant was not open by the time we had to leave. Luckily, we were able to find something to eat at the convention center. That was the only glitch in our stay. A number of the players (and their families) had lunch in the restaurant when we returned, and we got to watch the throngs of UConn fans walk by after the basketball game finished.

reviews.title: I would stay here again
reviews.text: On our second day, the team decided that we wanted to order pizza in rather than attempting to find a downtown restaurant that could take 20-30 people at once. The staff was happy to open up a meeting room for us to use, which was very much appreciated by all.

I helped my son move into an apartment for the summer and spent the evening at the Hilton. The front desk staff was extremely welcoming and willing to give me tons of information about Hartford. The room was modern, updated, and comfortable. My only suggestion would be to add valet parking as none of the reviewers on this site were pleased with having to walk through the parking lot. Hartford is a strange city with some seedy neighborhoods. But, if you walk in the direction of the XL center there are plenty of lovely restaurants and bars (loved Salute). We ended up spending a lot of time in West Hartford-lots of nice shops, restaurants and movies. I will definitely stay at the Hilton again when visiting my son.
reviews.title: A Good Visit

reviews.text: Loved loved loved this property. Was going to a concert at the XL center right next door, super location close to great restaurants, the Hartford Stage and the XL. Beautiful cozy room and super comfortable bed (I adore Hilton beds and linens) added bonus of a beautiful view of Hartford and the CT river. After the concert we ordered room service that I found to be dirt cheap for FAB food (my daughter said the best boneless chicken strips ever) Choc cake was divine. Went shopping in the AM and did not want to rush for check out, the staff had no problem extending me an hour (thank you). Nice pool and weight room.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Hartford

reviews.text: Breakfast in the AM we chose the buffet and it was great! This was a great stay and we will stay here again for sure!
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Good clean room, good service. Good location in downtown, close to the convention center where we were attending a large event hosted by the Art of Living. Free wireless internet in the lobby worked fast enough; it would have been great to have it in the rooms also. Free wired internet in the room also worked well.
reviews.title: And when I awoke - I was able to wrestle a cockroach the size of a small mouse

reviews.text: I am not kidding. I woke up one morning and went into the bathroom to take a shower and out of the corner of my eye i noticed some movement. There he/she was...frozen..under the sink area - the cockroach from hell. I know most of you are thinking...please, i am sure it was not that big. I knew no one would believe me, so i actually took pictures with my I-Phone as well as a short video. I was blown away. After i finally won the battle - having to crush it with the garbage can...I checked out of the hotel. I told the person at the front desk...to let the cleaning person know that there was a huge, dead cockroach in the room. The front desk person seemed shocked..and i guess in order to make it up to me offered me a free breakfast! of course that is the last place i would want to eat breakfast. The kicker of this entire ordeal is that after my stay I decided to share with Hilton - throught their Customer Service website - my ordeal...so they would know why i was no longer a customer....it has been 4 weeks and i still have not heard a peep back. Oh well....the Hilton name is just not what it used to be. shame.
reviews.title: NOISY room. Outdated.
Very comforting and enjoyable.
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Hartford during my visit to Connecticut on a family emergency. With all the worries and emotional drama. The staff made my stay very enjoyable and comforting. I am used to the big city scenery and I was taken by the colonial view from my hotel room. Room service was awesome and houskeeping really did a fantastic job. I would also like to thank the receptionist who assisted me when I lost my parking ticktet to get my car out of the garage.

reviews.title: This Hilton was very much sub-par
reviews.text: Stayed at this Hilton for business travel - i stay at about 25-30 Hiltons a year and found this facility to be very much below standard. Nothing really worked right - check-in took almost 30 minutes - my trip to the Fitness Center found both exercycles broken and quite dated and finally a simple order of a Greek Salad took 35 minutes to deliver in a basically empty restaurant. they did agree service was bad and offered to pay for my dinner which was a nice gesture - but the place was definetely off its game.

reviews.title: An AMAZING experience!
reviews.text: I planned a Surprise 50th Birthday party for my father and worked with Kris Yung and Sarah. They worked with my mother and I to accommodate 60 guests with an unforgettable night. They posted the event on a flatscreen billboard in the lobby, the food and decor was amazing and we received compliments all night. The bartender David was so friendly and kind, he too helped in making our event a serene reality. I would definietley reccommend the Hilton Hartford for events again and again and again. Thanks Hilton! You made our event a true success:c) ..................-Monique L. Walton

reviews.title: Very Good!
reviews.text: I stayed here with friends for NYE. I was a little hesitant because this Hilton has some bad reviews on TripAdvisor, but I had a great experience! I checked in at 3, the room was ready and very clean! It was very quiet, which was surprising because it was NYE, but the walls really kept outside noise out! The beds were comfy. It was not as "elegant" as other Hiltons I've stayed in, but for the price, it was definitely worth it! I would stay here again. It's right in the heart of downtown Hartford - and close to all the bars! There was also a pool/fitness center which looked nice, but I did not use it. I had a good and moderately priced breakfast at their restaurant downstairs, as well.

reviews.title: Comfort, quality and location
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the hotel this year. We were visiting the University of Hartford. The hotel was just as nice this time as last. We were welcomed back and provided with a comfortable room on the Club Floor. The hotel lobby was decorated for Christmas and very clean. The staff were all friendly and helpful. There is free Internet, parking is $18 extra in a garage below. Arriving late on a cold night, we opted to eat dinner in the lobby restaurant. It was very good food, reasonably priced and very relaxing. The room was quiet, clean, contemporary and comfortable. There was plenty of hot water and 5 pillows on each bed. Our stay came with free breakfast in the hotel restaurant. There was an extensive buffet, but table service was a little slow if you ordered off the menu. We would stay there again.

Everytime I stay here, it just gets better! It is the staff that make you feel at home and go entirely out of their way to do whatever they can to make your stay PERFECT! From room service, housekeeping (leaves a thank you card for tips), the shuttle driver (Glen rocks), front desk (everyone). They are hip and cool, polite and professional all at the same time. The staff in the M&M have the same hip, friendly, professional vibe. BEST corned beef hash on the plantet. Thank you Hartford Hilton for always making us feel at home and so valued as a guest in you space.....TR
reviews.title: Best hotel in Hartford BY FAR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff was nice it was clean ,quiet and in the middle of everyrhing. the food was great and it has an bar no need to leave the hotal at all!!
reviews.title: i love this hotal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like another reviewer, my husband and I stayed here when we were going to a concert the night before (we live 2 hours away). It was more expensive than others in the area, but it was very convenient, as it is connected to the XL Center. on the second floor, you can walk over to it. After the concert, there were only two others walking back to the hotel, so now cattle drive leaving :) It was very quiet too.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: Room was clean, water was hot (hottest I've ever experienced--even at home).
reviews.title: Great location and common areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Employees were pleasant.
reviews.title: Decent stay in downtown Hartford

reviews.text: High points of this hotel are:
reviews.title: Very good stay at the Hilton

reviews.text: * Very classy, tasteful, modern decor throughout the hotel
reviews.title: Very Nice hotel

reviews.text: * Recently renovated property with luxurious bedding
reviews.title: Very postive experience

likes.liked: — Newly renovated, good location for downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Hotel's location - it's a short walk to several restaurants and good stores
reviews.title: Happy at the Hilton

reviews.text: * Room service offered better than average food for breakfast -- prices aren't cheap, but they never are for room service, alas.
reviews.title: Not a good place!

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 night on business. Constantly woken up by truly excessive noise from the AC, the plumbing, and the ruckus from the street. I stayed on the 15th floor and still could hear every street noise that passed by. CONSTANT sirens wailing all night long. Property is also pretty dated. Obviously little to no soundproofing. Not even remotely worth the money, one notch up from Motel 6.
reviews.title: I will never stay here again. Our stay...
Great Location and Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: I just spent the night at the Hilton Downtown Hartford. I stayed at this hotel once before, but did not remember until I checked in. The staff recognized me immediately and put me in a room on the high level with access to the club level. The staff is very friendly and always willing to make recommendations for dinner and entertainment. The hotel is located downtown and parking can be a problem. However, the hotel staff was willing to pay for my parking fee and the bellman was able to park my car for me. This hotel is just off he Interstate and is easy to locate.

reviews.title: I'll Be Back
reviews.text: The sleeping room is well appointed and the pillows and mattress was very comfortable. The bathroom was a little small, but the shower worked had excellent water flow and plenty of towels. I noticed that there was a stain on the carpet, but it was not too bad.

reviews.title: Central Location, Consistent Service
reviews.text: I was at the hotel to conduct a seminar and I have to say, the Hilton staff was some of the best that I have ever experienced. The bellman had gotten the wrong box of materials out of my car and I did not discover it until the morning of the seminar. Tom Cannizaro, the Director of Food and Beverage insisted that he take care of the situation. Tom took my keys and retrieved the correct box. Also, in my hast to pack for five days in five different cities I had failed to pack a tie, Tom again insisted that he would go to house keeping to see if an old tie had been there. He returned with a that matched my suit perfectly. In addition, there was some difficulty with the AV in my conference room and both AV personnel and engineering came by to fix things. Tom continued to check with me throughout the day to make sure that everything occurred without a problem. When preparing to conduct a seminar there are many things to worry about. But, Tom's help made everything go off without a hitch. This really was excellent service.

reviews.title: Good location, poor service
reviews.text: I conduct approximately 200 conferences each year and stay in an equal amount of hotels. I can honestly say the Hilton in Hartford is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and certainly one of the best facilities I have ever conducted a conference in. The next time I am in Hartford I will certainly stay in the Hilton and would highly recommend it to anyone with business in Hartford.

reviews.title: Clea, in very good condition but not fancy
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Hartford for 5 days on business. This was my second time at that hotel and I will stay there again the next time I visit Harford on business. The room was clean and comfortable and just a couple of blocks from my company's Hartford office.

We went to CT to look at colleges for my son. We stayed one night at the Hilton in downtown Hartford. We are Hilton members so we received extra perks and had a room on a upper exclusive floor. The location is truly downtown and there is not a lot to do in this business district, but my younger son did enjoy the Discover Science Center. The hotel staff was efficient, friendly and helpful. Parking is an extra, $18 per day, and in an adjacent garage. This is an older hotel, but it has been refurbished and looked fairly fresh and contemporary. Our room was clean and comfortable, but small. There two beds were full size, not queen. The television worked, the bathroom was very nice and there were plenty of towels. They charge extra for WiFi, but we just used the free computer in the Members Lounge. Our room came with afternoon refreshments and a breakfast bar with coffee, juice, cereal, toast, fruit and hard boiled eggs. Overall, it was a pleasant experience. It is downtown and there are some city noises, but not enough to keep me awake. There is a large pool and fitness center. I would not recommend you try and put four people in the two beds, but for one night it was okay. It is right next door to the Hartford Stage and a major performance venue, so it would be a good place to stay if you were going to see a concert.
reviews.title: They treated us well

reviews.text: After reading some negative reviews, I hesitated staying here, but eventually took a chance. I was pleasantly surprised. My room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The bed was amazingly comfortable and made with fresh linens. Plenty of closet space to hang clothes, as well as an ironing board and iron. The staff was pleasant and efficient. They even had a small snack area where you could get pick up treats for your sweet tooth. Overall, I enjoyed my quick trip to Hartford.
reviews.title: I had a great stay in a great room

reviews.text: Okay, allow me to vent - why would you have a room (1404) with no where to hang any clothes?! Do you expect me to leave my coat, suit on the floor, on the bed, or a chair all night?!
reviews.title: Really, come-on AND non-responsive to boot...

reviews.text: There was one hook in the whole room, behind the bathroom door! No closet, no hangers, nothing.
reviews.title: "Days-Inn" in Hilton clothing

reviews.text: And you'd think responding to an email about your stay and leaving commentary such as the above would garnish a response...nope.
reviews.title: luxury hotel in a fringe area

reviews.text: Simply put, I expect more from a hilton.
reviews.title: unfit to be a hilton

reviews.text: Tiny lobby, weak water pressure, and lousy service.
reviews.title: No hot water?!

reviews.text: I've stayed at Hilton several times on both business and this time for pleasure. The hotel is pretty high volume business hotel and is becoming tired around the edges with stained carpets, frayed wall paper, and nicks and scratches on furniture , etc. For the rates charged by the hotel one would expect more up to date fit and finish in rooms and common areas... perhaps time for another renovation similar to the one pulled off a few years ago?.
reviews.title: Starting to show it's age again

reviews.text: The location for business meetings and conferences is quite good. However, parking charge at $18 / day feels a tad high, even for the location (surface lots two blocks away charge $6 / day).
reviews.title: Loud and poor customer service

reviews.text: We did have the opportunity to use the pool. It was remarkably cold. That's probably not too bad on a hot summer's day but it was too cold for an indoor pool during our October stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, Worth Considering

reviews.text: We did appreciate that free internet as many business hotels charge extorcionate rates for wi-fi.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: Things were ok, until we tried to order a movie - system was down and our final bill had 6 movie charges. Telephone did not work properly - customer service told us we didn't know how to use the phone. Smokers next door and we could smell the smoke all night. Noisy rooms. Wake up call was not on time. When we tried to call down to reception with our issues, we were transferred from one number to another and finally they told us we had to come down. When we did they said it wasn't their problem as they only just started their shift. Will stay somewhere else next time.
reviews.title: Not the best experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were going to a concert at the XL Center and didn't feel like driving all the way home afterward, so we chose to stay the night at the Hilton. It's connected to the XL Center, so it was extremely convenient, and there are so many bars and restaurants within walking distance. Check in was a breeze - there were three people working the counter when we arrived around 5:15 pm. I joined the Hilton Honors program before I booked and filled out the profile with my preferences, and *presto* they paid attention and I got what I like - high floor, king bed, room away from the elevator, etc. The room was spacious for a downtown city hotel and it was very clean. The bed was super comfy - got a great night's sleep. I didn't notice any street noise at all, but we were on the 17th floor, so I didn't expect any. Check out was so easy, it was non-existent - they slipped the invoice under the door and it wasn't necessary to even stop at the desk.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again next time we're up in Hartford and don't want to drive back the same night.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Good Location

reviews.text: I was in town for business at the CT Convention Center and stayed here for my Hilton Rewards Points, the decision was a good one. The Star Shuttle takes you all around the downtown area and picks up right on the corner across from the hotel for free. I also walked to many restaurants & bars while there and there are a lot of good options within just a couple blocks. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. I didn't try the on-site restaurant or bar.
reviews.title: Good stay!

reviews.text: The only weird thing about this property are the doors to the sleeping rooms. They really don't fit right and there is a two inch gap between the floor and the bottom of the door. It lets a lot of light in at night, so I put a bath towel down to solve the problem...that was really the only "negative" thing about my stay. I would definitely stay here again if I ever go to Hartford.
reviews.title: Good Stay-Consider Parking Charge and Sensitivity to Smell of Smoke

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights- for a downtown hotel it is great! There is a hotel shuttle and there is a bus stop right across the street to access the free bus that goes downtown. The rooms are quite nice, I liked the colors of room, very relaxing- and had a very sunny view! I got a king size bed which was very comfortable! The shampoo/conditioner they provide is wonderful!! The only downside is the parking per day is 18$, but there is a parking garage below the hotel. Other than that, a wonderful hotel!!! I would definitely suggest this hotel for anyone that is traveling in the Hartford area!
reviews.title: Great service, good location, comfortable bed

reviews.text: We arrived for a weekend stay to attend the Tina Turner concert next door at the XL Center. We were very leery about this hotel based on the recent reviews. We elected to go against the odds and book because of its proximity to the concert location. We paid a rate of $118 per night and admit that if we had paid more, we would have been highly disappointed. The rooms certainly weren't the cleanest and the walls seemed very thin. We had a connecting room next to strangers and could hear their conversation clearly (bride-to-be and her girlfriends). At 12:30 AM, I finally called the front desk to have them send someone up to address the noise. The plumbing pipes were also a nuisance and very noisy. The restaurant was very expensive, as was the internet. On the flip side, the beds were to die for and we had no problems falling asleep once our lovely neighbors quieted down. Another plus was that the parking garage had a side door so that one did not have to walk 1/2 block around the outside of the hotel. There is a Starbucks and a McDonalds within walking distance (2 blocks) as well as a nice shopping area just outside the hotel. It is also a block from the Hartford Stage Company and we had 2 bus loads of people attending something there making things pretty chaotic at check-out on Sunday. All in all a 3-star experience at best, but the staff really aimed to please and were helpful in every way. I would probably stay here again, but only if I were attending an event at the XL Center next door.
reviews.title: Great location for attending XL Center Events

reviews.text: I am a Diamond HHoners Hilton member, so I only stay in Hiltons. The Hartford Hilton treated me very nicely. The room was clean, spacious, and the wonderful Hilton beds make all the difference in travel. The day I arrived, there was a Manager's Reception, which I couldn't attend, but did meet the manager who was delightful. Hartford is not a top drawer place to go, in my opinion, but I will come back to this facility when business again calls me.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: this place is a mess, i stayed for a few days and in the time i was there the fire alarm went off not once, not twice, but three times! im not even kidding..it was the 8am sunday morning one that annoyed me the most...id honestly rather sleep in my car then ever sleep at this low budget mess of a hotel. keep that in mind before even stepping foot inside of this place.
reviews.title: what a mess
We Shall Never Return
reviews.text: First of all I want to say that the ONLY thing I found good about this hotel was the wonderful staff!! It seems that corporate HQ is most likely skimping on building maintenance and staffing in order to make a buck in this slower economy. Hey, tough times for a major corporation is not my problem. When I pay a premium for a room I expect the t.v. to work (fuzzy fuzzy picture, checked connections, they were ok) and I do not expect pipes in the bathroom to be banging all night. Waking up numerous times throughout the night---10;30 p.m. pipes banging, 1:30 a.m. pipes banging, 4:30 a.m. pipes banging, 5:30 a.m. pipes banging. Now when the pipes are banging, this is going on for a good 10 minutes straight, sometimes more.The weary staff have probably heard complaints about the pipes many, many times before, and informed me that it was because people were taking showers. Well, you can't tell someone "Stop taking a shower, you're waking everyone up!" Can you? It must be endured. The Hilton group obviously does not want to spend the money to fix a problem of which they are fully aware. I was told that my room would be changed the next morning but that fact would not necessarily guarantee there would be no banging pipes in the new room as well . I spent the morning calling around to find another hotel, but, as luck would have it, with a convention in town, everywhere was solidly booked. The next night, no banging pipes in the new room but as fate decided there would be no sleep for me that night either, a fire alarm went off at 11;30 p.m. and in my pajamas,wrapped in a coat, I walked down 19 flights into the cold night rain and stood across the street under an awning for what seemed like an hour until we got the all clear to go back to our rooms. I can't blame Hilton for a fire, evacuating people is the responsible thing to do but I was pretty darn cranky due to the lack of sleep that was their fault on the previous night and all I wanted to do was SLEEP!! As compensation for I was given $65 dollars of my final bill (that's 50% off of the rate for 1 nights stay) That was very decent of the manager but when I'm on holiday, I expect to get what I originally paid for which is a night of sleep. The prospect of no sleep for a discount does not appeal to me. My trip back to stitches east will totally depend on my accommodations, if the Hilton is the only place with vacancys, I shall skip the whole thing! Hilton Hartford better get the money while they can because I can't see why anyone would ever spend good money to be a repeat customer and there won't be many unsuspecting customers forever. To prove a point, call up and ask them if they can guarantee you a room with no banging pipes or your money will be 100% refunded, I bet they don't do it!!! They didn't when I called.

Another reviewer indicates the banging pipes (in our case during the middle of the night) were going to be looked at - turns out, this is to be expected, according to one staff person "It happens when the pipes expand and contract in this old building, we can't help when people take their showers".
reviews.title: Love banging pipes? This is for you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When staying at a premier property such as a Hilton it would be reasonable to expect top notch service. The Hotel itself with respect to their facilities was fine, however the service was lacking.
reviews.title: Hartford Hilton - Not The Beat Hilton

reviews.text: First, when asking for a bath robe to be brought to my room, a dozen extra bath towels were brought instead. Without a doubt, this was a language barrier issue, which was a prominent theme throughout the stay. When ordering room service for dinner, I was guaranteed the food would be there in 30 minutes, however after waiting 60 minutes, I called down to the Room Service number and they said "it would be right up in 5-10 minutes". The food arrived another 30 minutes later for a total of 1.5 hours to wait for dinner. The meal was very tasty, but the sides were cold at this point.
reviews.title: Pleasant Experience

likes.liked: — The room was quiet and comfortable.
likes.disliked: — The hotel bar was small and closed early.

reviews.text: When addressing this poor service with the hotel manager the next morning I requested the dinner be removed from the bill (comped). He gave me the "eye" that I was trying to scam them out of a free meal, hardly the case after paying $200 for the hotel room. He ended up taking $45 off the dinner for two (roughly half). I was not pleased with this; he also stated "well you did eat the meal". Of course, after waiting for 1.5 hours it was the least I could do. I also noted that the there was a piece ing carpeting missing from the floor going into the bathroom (blatant trip hazard, exposed concrete). This hotel is not horrible, but needs work with its customer service for it to be a "Real Top Property Hilton".
reviews.title: Worst Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton for four nights during a conference at the Connecticut Convention Center. The hotel is a 15 - 20 minute walk from the CCC. But the walk was through downtown and mostly nice.
reviews.title: Nice Room, No Bananas

likes.liked: — Nice lobby, good mood music, close to downtown businesses
likes.disliked: — Not a lot of retail/restaurants nearby

reviews.text: The hotel is very close to a number of good restaurants and pubs (try Asylum Street and Pratt Street). I ordered room service for my second morning at the hotel and the service and food were good.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Rooms are very small. Small easy chair w/o ottoman, very small closet, toilet located next to tub, you have to shut door to get out of tub, tv kept shorting out, maintenance called twice to fix it, housekeeping efficient and friendly. You can smell the kitchen from the elevators and in the hallways. Restaurant (Monty & Ming's) overpriced, lukewarm food, bad service, charged 18% gratuity on a breakfast buffet, had to ask 3x for beverages, etc. Final outrage, my mother sat on bench in locker room and it tore out of wall and collapsed to floor causing large bruise and breaking skin on her leg.
reviews.title: What didn't go wrong

reviews.text: Great customer service from the moment I checked in - was on the highest floor you could be on without being a club member. Rooms were comfortable, although my only complaint would be the $9.95 charge for internet access. Even budget hotels are offering free internet access nowadays. Was very impressed with the hotel bar - Element 315. Not only is it trendy in its decor, but the Friday night I was there they had a DJ playing great dance music! I thought I noticed a VIP room off the bar but didn't ask about it so don't know for sure. This is the place to have cocktails!
reviews.title: Stay here for the bar!

reviews.text: Within easy walking distance to theater and great restaurants and next to the Hartford Civic Center.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel

reviews.text: I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: the Best beds! Hip bar decor! 2 evacuations!

reviews.text: Stayed one night at the Hilton. It's in a very convenient location next to all major highways and the convention center. The staff was extremely friendly and service oriented, particularly at the restaurant, where I had a fine late night dinner and delicious oatmeal for breakfast. The room on the 16th floor was very clean and the bed was fantastic! It was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in! I did hear the highway a little bit even on the 16th floor, and as one reviewer commented, the location of the toilet paper is a bit strange, but overall a very pleasant one night stay for a business trip.
reviews.title: less than expected

reviews.text: I travel to Hartford on business a couple times of year and have stayed at the Goodwin, Marriott's and the Hilton Hartford twice. Being a Hilton Honors member, I was given the upper floors which usually is a perk. However, at the Hilton Hartford, be aware that if your room faces West you will have the Interstate 84 (Yankee highway) appearing to weave right towards you , you will have a constant highway din right through the windows especially if you are on the upper floors. If you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs just in case due to occasion late night construction, truckers, etc.
reviews.title: Hilton Hartford - Good for XL Center- Be ready for freeway noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are within walking distance of a couple of good restaurants, like Trumbull Kitchen and Dish's.
reviews.title: Okay hotel, nice staff but limited services...

reviews.text: First, it is the best location if you are attending a show / game / event at the XL Center (Hartford Civic Center). This Hilton is an older property that was renovated. Its looking fine but nothing fancy. We had two rooms and both were pretty small in size but very clean. The furniture is decent but like I said, it is nothing fancy. The issue with the hotel is one of no services or very limited services. There is no room service past 9:00pm and the bar downstairs closes at 10:00pm. We wanted to order a breakfast on saturday morning but could not get anything before 7:00am. The snack selection at front desk is very limited and there is nothing open around the hotel outside business hours. We paid $18.00 for parking but had to park our car as there is no valet parking. The staff was very friendly and helpfull but the Hilton Hartford lives up to the Hilton name for its rooms but for the rest, you could change it to a Hampton Inn since the services are lacking. We would still go there again but if you do want to book it, don`t expect much in the service departement.
reviews.title: Hartford and Hilton have seen better days...

reviews.text: During 5 day stay my room was changed twice: first because the internet did not work (which was $9.95 per day); and second because the air conditioner was broken.
reviews.title: NICKLED and DIMED to Death - and Depressing

reviews.text: The room I finally settled into had a view of the highway and a stained carpet and chair.
reviews.title: There must be better hotels in Hartford

description: The Hilton Hartford hotel is a shining star in the skyline of the historic city of Hartford, Connecticut. With a central Downtown location and connection to the XL Center, guests have access to outstanding area sports, cultural and consumer show events. Many of Hartford's corporate offices are also within walking distance of the Hilton Hartford.
